description: The American Community Survey (ACS) is an annual survey conducted by the US Census Bureau using a sample of the total population to create estimates. The Research Division created a series of profiles based on neighborhood and planning district boundaries. This profile contains demographic characteristics such as race and ethnicity, languages spoken at home, and educational attainment; economic characteristics such as occupation, per capital income, and poverty status; and housing characteristics such as occupancy status, gross rent, and housing tenure.
